5.1 Form

testedbeta version

The Form component is a wrapper to group all components inside an HTML Form logically related to the CSS.

The egeo-c-form AngularJS directive

Egeo includes an AngularJS directive to be used in Angular apps to allow developers to integrate the whole classes, properties and functionalities with no effort. The directive is the responsible of apply different styles depending of the status of the input itself and/or the form it is included on.

Directive settings

Variable Default value Description
id none The id of the form.
method none GET/POST.

Usage

<egeo-c-form id="TestForm" method="post">
     <egeo-c-formgroup>
         <label class="egeo-c-label" for="test1">test:</label><input class="egeo-c-input" type="text" id="test1">
     </egeo-c-formgroup>
     <egeo-c-input id="test2" label="test2" placeholder="put here your text" type="text"></egeo-c-input>
</egeo-c-form>

Dependencies

  • CSS Base Framework - components.form
Compatibility IE9+, Firefox Latest, Chrome Latest, Edge Latest, Safari Latest, Opera Latest

5.2 Form Group

testedbeta version

The Form Group component is a wrapper to group components inside an HTML Form that can be joined to work together. A typical example of a form group is a label with an input.

The egeo-c-formgroup AngularJS directive

Egeo includes an AngularJS directive to be used in Angular apps to allow developers to integrate the whole classes, properties and functionalities with no effort. The directive is the responsible of apply different styles depending of the status of the input itself and/or the form it is included on.

Usage

     <egeo-c-formgroup>
         <label class="egeo-c-label" for="test6">test:</label><input class="egeo-c-input" type="text" id="test6">
     </egeo-c-formgroup>

Will produce the result:

Dependencies

  • CSS Base Framework - components.formgroup
Compatibility IE9+, Firefox Latest, Chrome Latest, Edge Latest, Safari Latest, Opera Latest

5.4 Label

testedinternal

The Label Component is a class to show the Egeo custom version of an HTML label tag.

Directive settings

Variable Default value Description
id none The id of the labe.
label none The text of the label.

Usage

<egeo-c-label id="labelid" label="test"></egeo-c-label>

Will produce the next result:

Dependencies

  • CSS Base Framework - components.label
Compatibility IE9+, Firefox Latest, Chrome Latest, Edge Latest, Safari Latest, Opera Latest

5.5 Input

testedalpha version

The Input Component is a class to show the Ege ocustom version of an HTML input tag.

The egeo-c-input AngularJS directive

Egeo includes an AngularJS directive to be used in Angular apps to allow developers to integrate the whole classes, properties and functionalities with no effort. The directive is the responsible of apply different styles depending of the status of the input itself and/or the form it is included on.

Directive settings

Variable Default value Description
disabled false Tell whether the input is disabled or not.
helpText none The help text the component should show when the user clicks on the help icon.
id none The id of the input.
label none The text of the label will appear beside the input.
model none AngularJS model to bind the value of the component.
pattern none Pattern applied to validate content using Angular forms validation.
placeholder none Placeholder value of the input.
qa none Identifier used by QA team for testing purposes.
required false Tell whether the input is required or not.
type none HTML type of the input (check options here).

Usage

<div ng-controller="TestController as vm">
  <egeo-c-form id="TestForm" method="post">
     <egeo-c-input data-id="username" data-label="username" data-placeholder="Ex. dwalsh" data-type="text" data-model="vm.username" data-pattern="'([a-zA-Z0-9]*)'" data-required="true" data-qa="id-for-username" data-help-text="The username is needed to login into our applications. Only numbers and letters are allowed."></egeo-c-input>
     <egeo-c-input data-id="city" data-label="city" data-placeholder="Ex. Madrid" data-type="text" data-model="vm.city" data-pattern="'([a-zA-Z]*)'" data-qa="id-for-city" data-help-text="The city will be used to gather stat info."></egeo-c-input>
     <egeo-c-input data-id="freetext" data-label="free text" data-placeholder="Ex. No contextual help but errors (try put whitespaces)" data-type="text" data-model="vm.other" data-pattern="'([a-zA-Z]*)'" data-qa="id-for-free-text"></egeo-c-input>
  </egeo-c-form>
</div>

Dependencies

  • CSS Base Framework - components.input
  • CSS Base Framework - components.label
  • CSS Base Framework - components.helpbox
  • CSS Base Framework - components.message
  • CSS Base Framework - components.icon
Compatibility IE9+, Firefox Latest, Chrome Latest, Edge Latest, Safari Latest, Opera Latest

5.6 Checkbox

testedalpha version

The Checkbox Component is a class to show the Egeo custom version of an HTML input checkbox tag.

The egeo-c-checkbox AngularJS directive

@mixintested

Egeo includes an AngularJS directive to be used in Angular apps to allow developers to integrate the whole classes, properties and functionalities with no effort. The directive is the responsible of apply different styles depending of the status of the checkbox itself and/or the form it is included on.

Directive settings

Variable Default value Description
disabled false Tell whether the checkbox is disabled or not.
helpText none The help text the component should show when the user clicks on the help icon.
id none The id of the input.
label none The text of the label will appear beside the checkbox.
model none AngularJS model to bind the value of the component.
qa none Identifier used by QA team for testing purposes.
required false Tell whether the checkbox is required or not.

Usage

<div ng-controller="TestController as vm">
  <egeo-c-form id="TestForm" method="post">
     <egeo-c-checkbox data-id="test-checkbox" data-label="I read and accept the conditions" data-required="true" data-qa="id-for-checkbox" data-help-text="The acceptance of conditions is needed to continue."></egeo-c-checkbox>
  </egeo-c-form>
</div>

Dependencies

  • CSS Base Framework - components.checkbox
  • CSS Base Framework - components.label
  • CSS Base Framework - components.helpbox
  • CSS Base Framework - components.message
  • CSS Base Framework - components.icon
Compatibility IE9+, Firefox Latest, Chrome Latest, Edge Latest, Safari Latest, Opera Latest

5.7 Combobox

testedalpha version

The Combobox Component is a class to show the Egeo custom version of an HTML input select tag.

The egeo-c-combobox AngularJS directive

@mixintested

Egeo includes an AngularJS directive to be used in Angular apps to allow developers to integrate the whole classes, properties and functionalities with no effort. The directive is the responsible of apply different styles depending of the status of the combobox itself and/or the form it is included on.

Directive settings

Variable Default value Description
disabled false Tell whether the select is disabled or not.
helpText none The help text the component should show when the user clicks on the help icon.
id none The id of the select.
label none The text of the label will appear beside the select.
model none AngularJS model to bind the value of the component.
options none An array of objects with label/value/selected properties to create the options of the select. Sample: [{id: 1, label: "opt 1", selected: false}, {id: 2, label: "opt 2", selected: true}, {id: 3, label: "opt 3"}];
qa none Identifier used by QA team for testing purposes.
required false Tell whether the select is required or not.
text none The text will appear inside the select if none was selected.

Usage

<div ng-controller="TestController as vm">
  <egeo-c-form id="TestForm" method="post">
     <egeo-c-combobox data-text="--- Please select ---" data-options="{{vm.cboptions}}" data-model="{{vm.cbovalue}}" data-id="test-combobox" data-label="Select an option" data-required="true" data-qa="id-for-combobox" data-help-text="Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.">
     </egeo-c-combobox>
  </egeo-c-form>
</div>

Dependencies

  • CSS Base Framework - components.combobox
  • CSS Base Framework - components.label
  • CSS Base Framework - components.helpbox
  • CSS Base Framework - components.message
  • CSS Base Framework - components.icon
Compatibility IE9+, Firefox Latest, Chrome Latest, Edge Latest, Safari Latest, Opera Latest

5.8 Radiobutton

testedalpha version

The radiobutton Component is a class to show the Egeo custom version of an HTML input radiobutton tag.

The egeo-c-radiobutton AngularJS directive

@mixintested

Egeo includes an AngularJS directive to be used in Angular apps to allow developers to integrate the whole classes, properties and functionalities with no effort. The directive is the responsible of apply different styles depending of the status of the radiobutton itself and/or the form it is included on.

Directive settings

Variable Default value Description
disabled false Tell whether the radiobutton is disabled or not.
helpText none The help text the component should show when the user clicks on the help icon.
id none The id of the input.
label none The text of the label will appear beside the radiobutton.
model none AngularJS model to bind the value of the component.
qa none Identifier used by QA team for testing purposes.
required false Tell whether the radiobutton is required or not.

Usage

<div ng-controller="TestController as vm">
  <egeo-c-form id="TestForm" method="post">
     <egeo-c-radiobutton data-id="test-radiobutton1" data-cname="radiobutton-name" data-value="1" data-label="opt 1" data-required="true" data-qa="id-for-radiobutton" data-help-text="Lorem ipsum dolor."></egeo-c-radiobutton>
     <egeo-c-radiobutton data-id="test-radiobutton2" data-cname="radiobutton-name" data-value="2" data-label="opt 2" data-required="true" data-qa="id-for-radiobutton" data-help-text="Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet."></egeo-c-radiobutton>
  </egeo-c-form>
</div>

Dependencies

  • CSS Base Framework - components.radiobutton
  • CSS Base Framework - components.label
  • CSS Base Framework - components.helpbox
  • CSS Base Framework - components.message
  • CSS Base Framework - components.icon
Compatibility IE9+, Firefox Latest, Chrome Latest, Edge Latest, Safari Latest, Opera Latest

5.11 Button

internaltestedbeta version

The egeo-c-button AngularJS directive

@directivetested

Egeo provides an AngularJS directive to create all types of buttons defined with ease. The directive is restricted to HTML Element and called egeo-c-button. Below you can see the properties exposed:

Directive settings

Property Description
at-right Floats the button to right
icon-left An icon which appears at left side
icon-right An icon which appears at right side
label The label of the button
modifier The name of the button created as a CSS BEM Modifier
popover internalIt is used to reference popover IDs when the button is linked to a popover.
rounded A rounded version of the button. A rounded button will hide the label and only show the icon.
small A small version of the button
type Submit, Reset or Button

Usage

Take a look to the samples shown below to see how the properties could be used and combined to get different results:

  <div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="main-1" data-label="AngularJS Button: Click to test ({{count}})" data-ng-click="count = count + 1"></egeo-c-button></div>
  <div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="main-2" data-icon-left="icon-cog" data-icon-right="icon-arrow2_down" data-label="AngularJS Button"></egeo-c-button></div>
  <div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="main-3" data-label="AngularJS Button"></egeo-c-button></div>
  <div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="secondary-1" data-label="AngularJS Button"></egeo-c-button></div>
  <div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="secondary-1" data-icon-left="icon-cog" data-small="true" data-label="AngularJS Button Small"></egeo-c-button></div>
  <div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="danger" data-label="AngularJS Danger Button"></egeo-c-button></div>
  <div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="danger" data-icon-left="icon-cog" data-label="AngularJS Disabled Button" disabled></egeo-c-button></div>
  <div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-1" data-rounded="true" data-icon-left="icon-datetime"></egeo-c-button></div>
  <div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-1" data-rounded="true" data-small="true" data-icon-left="icon-datetime"></egeo-c-button></div>
  <div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-2" data-rounded="true" data-icon-left="icon-datetime"></egeo-c-button></div>
  <div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-2" data-rounded="true" data-small="true" data-icon-left="icon-datetime"></egeo-c-button></div>
  <div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-ellipsis" data-rounded="true" data-icon-left="icon-waiting"></egeo-c-button></div>
  <div style="margin-bottom: 5px"><egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-ellipsis" data-rounded="true" data-small="true" data-icon-left="icon-waiting"></egeo-c-button></div>
  <div style="margin-bottom: 5px; overflow: auto"><egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="ellipsis" data-rounded="true" data-small="true" data-icon-left="icon-datetime" data-at-right="true"></egeo-c-button></div>

Dependencies

  • CSS Base Framework - components.button
  • CSS Base Framework - components.icon
  • CSS Base Framework - utils.floats
Compatibility IE9+, Firefox Latest, Chrome Latest, Edge Latest, Safari Latest, Opera Latest

5.12 Button Group

testedbeta version

The Button Group component is a wrapper to group a set of Egeo Buttons. You can use only the CSS styles but probably has no sense due to the whole functionality is only available via the AngularJS Directive.

The egeo-c-buttongroup AngularJS directive

@directivetested

Egeo provides an AngularJS directive to create button groups with ease. The directive is restricted to HTML Element and called egeo-c-buttongroup. Below you can see the properties exposed:

Directive settings

Property Description
small Tell to the directive if the more button will be small or not.
popoverToRight Tell to the directive if the popover should behave as if placed in the right side of the website. This means that the popover would be shown from the ellipsis button to the left. The component automatically checks if the popover would be placed outside the viewport and the will apply this behavior regardless of the property value.

Warning: Keep in mind that the egeo-c-buttongroup Angular Directive is only allowed to be used with egeo-c-buttons as inside elements. Use it combined with other elements may have unexpected effects.

Usage

<div data-ng-controller="TestController as TestCtrl">
     <egeo-c-buttongroup>
         <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-1" data-label="Test 1" data-rounded="true" data-icon-left="icon-datetime" data-ng-click="TestCtrl.test()"></egeo-c-button>
         <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-1" data-label="Test 2" data-rounded="true" data-small="true" data-icon-left="icon-datetime" data-ng-click="TestCtrl.test()"></egeo-c-button>
         <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-2" data-label="Test 3" data-rounded="true" data-icon-left="icon-datetime" data-ng-click="TestCtrl.test()"></egeo-c-button>
     </egeo-c-buttongroup>
</div>
<p>The same buttongroup in a container of 110px wide.</p>
<div style="width: 110px" data-ng-controller="TestController as TestCtrl">
     <egeo-c-buttongroup small="true">
         <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-1" data-label="Test 1" data-rounded="true" data-icon-left="icon-datetime" data-ng-click="TestCtrl.test()"></egeo-c-button>
         <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-1" data-label="Test 2" data-rounded="true" data-small="true" data-icon-left="icon-datetime" data-ng-click="TestCtrl.test()"></egeo-c-button>
         <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-2" data-label="Test 3" data-rounded="true" data-icon-left="icon-datetime" data-ng-click="TestCtrl.test()"></egeo-c-button>
     </egeo-c-buttongroup>
</div>
<p>The same buttongroup in a container of 110px wide and right aligned.</p>
<div style="text-align: right; margin-right: 10px">
  <div style="display: inline-block; width: 110px" data-ng-controller="TestController as TestCtrl">
     <egeo-c-buttongroup popover-to-right="true">
         <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-1" data-label="Test 1" data-rounded="true" data-icon-left="icon-datetime" data-ng-click="TestCtrl.test()"></egeo-c-button>
         <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-1" data-label="Test 2" data-rounded="true" data-small="true" data-icon-left="icon-datetime" data-ng-click="TestCtrl.test()"></egeo-c-button>
         <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-2" data-label="Test 3" data-rounded="true" data-icon-left="icon-datetime" data-ng-click="TestCtrl.test()"></egeo-c-button>
     </egeo-c-buttongroup>
  </div>
</div>

To view the results of click actions, open the Javascript conole of your browser.

The same buttongroup in a container of 110px wide.

The same buttongroup in a container of 110px wide and right aligned.

Dependencies

  • components.button
  • CSS Base Framework - components.buttongroup
  • CSS Base Framework - components.popover
Compatibility IE9+, Firefox Latest, Chrome Latest, Edge Latest, Safari Latest, Opera Latest

5.14 Row

testedbeta version

The Row Component is a container which uses always 100% width and never floats.

The egeo-c-row AngularJS directive

@directivetested

Egeo provides an AngularJS directive to create rows with ease. The directive is restricted to HTML Element and called egeo-c-row. The Row component is a container so it allows to use transclude content. Below you can see the properties exposed:

Directive settings

Property Default value Description
content-at-right false If the content will be right aligned
content-centered false If the content will be center aligned
variant none Background colors. Now b1, b2, b3, b3_dark and b4 are set by default.

Usage

Take a look to the samples shown below to see how the properties could be used and combined to get different results:

<egeo-c-row><egeo-c-button type="submit" modifier="main-1" label="AngularJS Button: Click to test ({{count}})" data-ng-click="count = count + 1"></egeo-c-button></egeo-c-row>
<egeo-c-row data-content-at-right="true"><egeo-c-button type="submit" modifier="main-1" label="AngularJS Button: Click to test ({{count}})" data-ng-click="count = count + 1"></egeo-c-button></egeo-c-row>
<egeo-c-row data-content-centered="true"><egeo-c-button type="submit" modifier="main-1" label="AngularJS Button: Click to test ({{count}})" data-ng-click="count = count + 1"></egeo-c-button></egeo-c-row>

Dependencies

  • CSS Base Framework - components.row
  • CSS Base Framework - utils.alignments
Compatibility IE9+, Firefox Latest, Chrome Latest, Edge Latest, Safari Latest, Opera Latest

5.15 Toolbar

testedbeta version

The Toolbar Component is a container of items which will be added one behind the other.

egeo-c-toolbar

@mixintestedinternal

Injects the general behavior and properties of the class Toolbar to other components of the UI Kit.

The egeo-c-toolbar AngularJS directive

@directiveuntested

Egeo provides an AngularJS directive to create toolbars with ease. The directive is restricted to HTML Element and called egeo-c-toolbar. The Toolbar component is a container so it allows to use transclude content. Below you can see the properties exposed:

Directive settings

Property Default value Description
at-right
false
If the content will be right floated

Usage

Take a look to the samples shown below to see how the properties could be used and combined to get different results:

<egeo-c-toolbar>
  <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="main-1" data-label="AngularJS Button: Click to test ({{count}})" data-ng-click="count = count + 1"></egeo-c-button>
  <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="main-2" data-icon-left="icon-cog" data-icon-right="icon-arrow2_down" data-label="AngularJS Button"></egeo-c-button>
  <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="main-3" data-label="AngularJS Button"></egeo-c-button>
  <egeo-c-button data-type="submit" data-modifier="tool-ellipsis" data-rounded="true" data-icon-left="icon-waiting"></egeo-c-button>
</egeo-c-toolbar>

Dependencies

  • CSS Base Framework - components.toolbar
  • CSS Base Framework - utils.floats
Compatibility IE9+, Firefox Latest, Chrome Latest, Edge Latest, Safari Latest, Opera Latest
Created using kss-node and kss-node-template.
